intro: Lacmellea utilis, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine hairs, and its small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
